May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"grantTrustedAttester(address)":{"params":{"attester":"Address to grant the role to"}},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"initialize()":{"details":"Initialize the contract"},"initialize(address,uint256,uint256,uint256,address[])":{"params":{"_custodians":"Array of custodian addresses","_epochDuration":"The duration of each epoch","_lastAcceptedBlockHeight":"The last accepted block height","_leadingBlockTolerance":"The tolerance for leading blocks","_stakingContract":"The staking contract to use"}},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"setAcceptedCommitmentAtBlockHeight((uint256,bytes32,bytes32))":{"params":{"blockCommitment":"The block commitment to set"}},"setLastAcceptedBlockHeight(uint256)":{"params":{"height":"New last accepted block height"}},"setOpenAttestationEnabled(bool)":{"params":{"enabled":"Boolean indicating if open attestation should be enabled"}},"setRewardContract(address)":{"details":"Only callable by admin","params":{"_rewardContract":"The contract that implements IMcrReward"}},"stake(uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount to stake"}},"submitBatchBlockCommitment((uint256,bytes32,bytes32)[])":{"params":{"blockCommitments":"Array of block commitments to submit"}},"submitBlockCommitment((uint256,bytes32,bytes32))":{"params":{"blockCommitment":"The block commitment to submit"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."},"unstake(uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount to unstake"}},"upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow-reachable":"delegatecall","details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. params.accounts: Array of addresses to grant the role to

params.attesters: Array of addresses to grant the role to

computeAllStakeAtEpoch(uint256,address).details: TODO: Consider memoizing this function for efficiency

returns._0: uint256 Total stake for current epoch
uint256 Total stake for the epoch

forceLatestCommitment((uint256,bytes32,b.details: Only safe when running with a single validator as it does not zero out follow-on commitments

returns._0: address[] memory Array of attester addresses
uint256 Current epoch by block time

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

returns._0: uint256 Total stake for current epoch

params.account: Address to grant the role to

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

params.attester: Address to grant the role to

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.enabled: Boolean indicating if open attestation should be enabled

params.blockCommitments: Array of block commitments to submit

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

acceptedBlocks(uint256).notice: Maps block height to accepted block commitment

batchGrantCommitmentAdmin(address[]).notice: Grants commitment admin role to multiple accounts in batch

batchGrantTrustedAttester(address[]).notice: Grants trusted attester role to multiple accounts in batch

blockHeightEpochAssignments(uint256).notice: Maps each block height to its corresponding epoch

commitmentStakes(uint256,bytes32).notice: Tracks total stake accumulated for each commitment at each block height

commitments(uint256,address).notice: Tracks commitments from each attester for each block height

computeAllCurrentEpochStake(address).notice: Computes the total stake across all custodians for an attester at the current epoch

computeAllStakeAtEpoch(uint256,address).notice: Computes the total stake across all custodians for an attester at a specific epoch

computeAllTotalStakeForCurrentEpoch().notice: Computes the total stake across all custodians for the current epoch

computeAllTotalStakeForEpoch(uint256).notice: Computes the total stake across all custodians for a specific epoch

createBlockCommitment(uint256,bytes32,by.notice: Creates a new block commitment structure

forceLatestCommitment((uint256,bytes32,b.notice: Forces the latest attestation by setting the block height

getAcceptedCommitmentAtBlockHeight(uint2.notice: Gets the accepted commitment at a specific block height

getAttesters().notice: Gets all attesters for this domain

getCurrentEpoch().notice: Gets the current epoch up to which blocks have been accepted

getCurrentEpochStake(address,address).notice: Gets the stake for a given attester at the current epoch

getEpochByBlockTime().notice: Gets the epoch for the current block time

getMaxTolerableBlockHeight().notice: Calculates the maximum tolerable block height based on tolerance

getStakeAtEpoch(uint256,address,address).notice: Gets the stake for a given attester at a specific epoch

getTotalStakeForCurrentEpoch(address).notice: Gets the total stake for a custodian at the current epoch

getTotalStakeForEpoch(uint256,address).notice: Gets the total stake for a given epoch and custodian

getValidatorCommitmentAtBlockHeight(uint.notice: Gets a validator's commitment at a specific block height

grantCommitmentAdmin(address).notice: Grants commitment admin role to an account

grantTrustedAttester(address).notice: Grants trusted attester role to an account

lastAcceptedBlockHeight().notice: Tracks the last accepted block height

leadingBlockTolerance().notice: The number of blocks that can be submitted ahead of the lastAcceptedBlockHeight

setAcceptedCommitmentAtBlockHeight((uint.notice: Sets the accepted commitment at a given block height

setLastAcceptedBlockHeight(uint256).notice: Sets the last accepted block height

stake(uint256).notice: Allows users to stake tokens for the MCR domain

submitBatchBlockCommitment((uint256,byte.notice: Submits multiple block commitments in batch

unstake(uint256).notice: Allows users to unstake tokens from the MCR domain

@notice The role for trusted attester

@notice Calculates the maximum tolerable block height based on tolerance
 @return uint256 Maximum tolerable block height

@notice Gets the next epoch
